name: BEST WESTERN PREMIER Grand Canyon Squire Inn

reviews.text: The good: comfortable room, close to the park gate, excellent dining room. The hotel's main restaurant has excellent service and better food than I expected out in the middle of nowhere. A bowling alley and game room are good for keeping the family occupied after dark when there's nothing to see at the canyon.
reviews.title: Good hotel, spotty service

reviews.text: The bad: Stop in the hotel's coffee shop for breakfast in the morning and expect to be ignored. Our room's toilet had a problem and it took 4 calls to the front desk to get someone to respond. The front desk is a little slow.
reviews.title: Not perfect, but far from lackluster

reviews.text: Considering that it can be expensive to stay here, the lousy service changes this hotel from one that I would check first to one I would check last.
reviews.title: Well, they do not know what service means
OK, but will look for other options next time
reviews.text: But even if you don't stay here, check out their dining room. It's the best food I've had at the Canyon.

reviews.title: Great place to visit Grand Canyon
reviews.text: Conveniently located in a cluster of steakhouses, general stores, fast food joints and other hotels outside the southern rim of the Grand Canyon, this older but well-maintained facility is perfectly adequate for a night or two.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Grand Canyon is a stunning, unmissable natural wonder, and to visit it I would willingly put up with sleeping in a complete turkey of a hotel. So I did. This place is as forgettable and drab a hotel as you will ever find - the room was dark and had an interesting smell to it, the restaurant food was shocking, they actually CHARGE to use the safe, the wifi only works if you are actually sitting directly on top of the wireless router, and the staff are utterly indifferent. This place would collapse into bankruptcy in 5 minutes were it not one of a tiny handful of hotels situated next to one of the most beautiful places on earth. Sleep in your car instead, and avoid having to write a review like this one.
reviews.title: $19 for the hotel, $200 for the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as part of a Southwest trip to Zion, Bryce and both the North and South Rims of Grand Canyon, so we experienced a variety of lodging and food choices over nine days. This motel is very nice and offers entertainment choices which may be of interest to families (bowling, video arcade, pool) but we just needed one night's basic accomodation. Apparently the town has reception difficulty with TV and/or internet, but this was not a big concern to us. There was no remote for the TV, so we inquired at the desk. An hour later a maintenace man brought us one, very apologetic that it had taken so long. We usually don't watch TV in motels anyway, so it was not a big deal, but it's nice to know that they pride themselves on being responsive.
reviews.title: Nice but expensive

reviews.text: I had checked out options at the South Rim as well as Tusayan and decided on the Best Western even tho it cost the most of any places we stayed. The room had a separate second sink outside the bathroom and included a fridge, which I always enjoy having. The room and entire hotel was very clean and well-maintained and quiet (we were on the 3rd floor). They were re-paving the parking lots, so parking was at a premium. Not sure if this was the reason, but the desk clerk "upgraded" us from one of the outlying buildings into the main hotel. We decided to eat dinner in the hotel rather than risk losing the parking spot we had snagged, so we tried the buffet (seasonal only?) at $17. It was OK, not a lot of veggie choices. The breakfast buffet offered many choices; it appeared that all of the guests were having breakfast when we were. We have no complaints.
reviews.title: Service lets it down

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night on a trip to the canyon. The exterior of the hotel is very nice and the lobby area us well laid out and smart. The hotel is of a four star level. I was disappointed with the check in, for £150 per night I expected better. The three staff looked a mess in shabby orange shirts and they seemed totally disinterested. The rooms itself was lovely and I had a good nights sleep on a bed I could barely manage to get on it was so high!!
reviews.title: Good functional hotel for a one nighter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I used the sports bar and the pool table, this was good as there was little else to do in the town.
reviews.title: Convenient hotel to the Grand Canyon

reviews.text: This is by far the largest, busiest and at $200 a night the most expensive Best Western I have stayed at. You will have plenty to do to keep the family entertained at this Premier hotel. It was too large and busy for my liking but since I am a Best Western Rewards member it was the only BW near the Grand Canyon. We had dinner in the main restaurant and our food was great. The dining was upscale and not like a typical hotel fast food venue. The location of the hotel is perfect if you can't get a room within the Park. The IMAX is a block away for something to do at night.
reviews.title: A bowling alley at a hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only booked here because the accomodation closer to the Canyon was fully booked, and to be honest our expectations weren't high. We had been told that Tusayan was 'touristy' and we expected this hotel to be barely adequate. But we were wrong on both counts. Tusayan itself is ok (it's not the classiest of places, but it's clean, neatly laid-out and is a perfectly fine place to stay), the Best Western Grand Canyon Squire was an even better suprise. The receptionist was very friendly and helpful, our room was clean, spacious and pretty-well equipped, and overall,considering this hotel seems to cater for mass tourism (there were a few coaches parked outside) it was really pretty good, they obviously made a real effort to look after guests. The biggest disappointment was the breakfast buffet, not the food which was fine, but the room which was rather gloomy.But that was a minor problem.
reviews.title: A perfectly acceptable base to visit the Grand Canyon

reviews.text: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. I didn't expect it to be as nice as it was. Also I hadn't realized that a free breakfast buffet was included. That was a nice surprise. Very nice breakfast offerings, large comfortable clean room and laundry facilities made this a great place to stay for exploring the Grand Canyon. Also it is in a very convenient location.
reviews.title: Very Nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a first visit to the Grand Canyon. We stayed one night at the Best Western in Tusayan and another night at a lesser property. I will say that our room was large and very clean. We had two queen beds and we booked through Booking.com for $178 PLUS TAX. Which made this expensive as far as we were concerned, but I booked it because it was close to the park and all the " in the park" hotels were already full.
reviews.title: Worth the price ????

reviews.text: Our room was very clean and had upgrades including an I-pod dock and a "clean" remote control, which was wrapped in a bag. The breakfast was included and was good. The dining room was pleasant and clean. The buffet included frozen waffles and premade sausage patties, the usual scrambled eggs and toast. Fresh fruit and cereal of course. I did notice that bacon was missing from the choices. The food was fine, but not really up to the quality that I expected.
reviews.title: Terrible Customer Service
Pleasant and comfortable
reviews.text: Convenient for the rim a short drive away. Stayed here two years ago and enjoyed the hospitality.

reviews.title: Great place to stopover
reviews.text: Room large, clean and comfortable and no issues of hot water others have mentioned.
Enjoyed the bar and the bar meal with pleanty of choices of food and beers on tap.
reviews.title: Needs updating, very dated !

reviews.text: Breakfast had ample choice and was regularly replenished. The hotel was very busy but had no sense of overcrowding.
reviews.title: Great location for visiting the Grand Canyon

reviews.text: Staff were helpful and friendly and room was excellent. A little more expensive than some of the others on our vacation but amenities were extensive and the price probably reflects the location. Overall, very comforable and also good value.
reviews.title: Nice and cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a pricey hotel approx 6 miles south of the Grand Canyon South Rim. At $185 per night with b'fast, this is a pricey hotel but the blocks in which the main bedrooms are housed are dingy with poor lighting and terribly worn and grimey carpeting. The bedrooms and bathrooms are a reasonable size and generally in better condition than the corridors. There's plenty of parking space.The bed had a 'pillow' mattress which took some getting used to but was comfortable enough.
reviews.title: Decidedly not Premier class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took one look at the restaurant menu and decided to try our luck elsewhere (the Yippe ei O steakhouse up the street which was OK, not great). The buffet breakfast included some hot food options and was passable.
reviews.title: Service is not "Premier"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel boasted high speed wi-fi in all rooms when we booked but in fact this is non existent and had not been for several months before we booked. There's even a letter from the Mayor of Tusayan in the rooms saying don't blame the hotels for the lack of wi-fi, it's all the fault of the ISP who won't upgrade the service...or something to that effect. We tested the wi-fi speed in the hotel lobby, the only spot with even a minimal service. It was 0.36mbps!!!. We'd expect high speed wi-fi to be 15.0mbps at a minimum. We complained and by way of recompense we got the $1.50 daily charge for the room safe knocked off the bill (never ever seen a charge for these before!!).
reviews.title: "Grand" indeed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Throughout the stay all the staff were pretty cheerful, a pleasant change from Monument Valley but, judging by TA reviews, if this is #1 hotel in Tusayan there's a big opportunity for some firm to open up and get a good price for a real premier service.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location, no internet connection

reviews.text: It may be in a Premier location just a few miles from the park entrance and the additional facilities may make this a Premier property, but the service is definitely not Premier. On arrival we were given a room that was already occupied and and only got a reluctant apology after having to carry our cases up and down stairs and back to reception to be allocated a new room. Breakfast was like a scrum, the "hot" section of the buffet was cold, and there was hardly anywhere to sit. Dinner in the Coronado Room was good, but the service was poor - one night we had to wait 35 minutes before getting a salad appetizer and the restaurant did not appear to be that busy. They advertise free wi-fi but we could not get it in our room. Overall a good location, comfortable rooms, and for those who want them a number of additional facilities, but for us this was all let down by poor service.
reviews.title: Great location for Grand Canyon visit.

reviews.text: This hotel has everything you need nice restaurant bowling and a sports bar not to mention the rooms have been updated and are quite nice. they have in room coffee and free breakfast buffet in the early evening they have an early bird specials and very good food for $15.00
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Check in was smooth, the staff very helpful.
reviews.title: Best Western Premier, Tusayan

reviews.text: Good sized room and bathroom. Toiletries provided. TV, coffee making, fridge and in room safe.
reviews.title: Close to Grand Canyon National Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is not 5 star but the fixtures and furnishings are of a reasonable standard and condition.
reviews.title: We were pleased we stayed here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room cleaned daily.
reviews.title: Good choice for viewing the South Rim

reviews.text: Best Western Grand Canyon Squire Inn is in Tusayan, just a few miles from the entrance of the Grand Canyon National Park. The location is very convenient.
reviews.title: Unremarkable motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a motel with old (probably from the 70's) and ugly furniture, with basic comfort.
reviews.title: Good value...close to Grand Canyon

reviews.text: As for breakfast it's a buffet, with nothing really good.
reviews.title: Expensive, but worth it!
happily surprised
reviews.text: It's OK for a night's sleep, but I think it's outrageous to pay $210 (plus taxes) for such an ordinary motel.
Best Western Grand Canyon is a nice hotel offers reasonable value for something so close to the park entrance. There are several wings to the hotel, some of which are in separate buildings.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: We had a spacious room with a large bathroom (I think we may have had a small upgrade) in the main building. The room was very comfortable and very clean, with a table with 4 chairs and an armchair. We had to make use of the laundry facilities which worked well, but we were fortunate to be located relatively near to them; I think many rooms in the hotel would be very far away. As I said, the room was spacious but had very little storage space outside of the closet; just two small drawers when there was plenty of space for dressers. The wi-fi wasn't great, but that seems to be a general problem in the area. It worked better at off-peak times. The location is very good as there is a shuttle bus stop outside the hotel. The pool was nice. We had supper in the sports bar one evening for convenience and that was fine. The breakfast was very busy and had a lot of variety but some items weren't very appealing (the pancakes and waffles in particular). I also would have appreciated water being available with breakfast.
reviews.title: We enjoyed our stay here but it's pricey

reviews.text: Our family flew in from NJ to Phoenix in the morning and drove to the Grand Canyon. We arrived at the hotel at 6:30, but still waited about 20 minutes to check in. The room was clean and very spacious. Disappointed with the internet service, but the hotel said all internet service in this area was bad. Hotel service was very good. We asked for an extra bed and it was delivered within 10 minutes. Plus, we received a call from housekeeping to make sure we were satisfied with it.
reviews.title: Had a very nice stay with the family!

reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent. Nice selection - fruits, oatmeal, grits, pancakes, waffles, scrambled eggs (fresh, not watery when made with the powdery stuff). The kids loved the bowling alley. The fitness center was very tiny. It can only accomodate like 4 people max. But, who needs the gym when you get a work out just by hiking the park?
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise

reviews.text: It is a few miles driving to get to the park, but the drive is pleasant. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Expensive for what you get, but nice enough

reviews.text: After reading all those reviews about the Tusayan hotels we were a bir concerned about the quality and the service. We could switch for the Best Western in the very last moment from a more expensive option though we still paid some 180 USD. The check-in went smoothly, and the staff was very welcoming. The room was fine, not the best, bit dark an outdated design but clean and tidy. The breakfast was simply great. Anyway who spend time in the hotel room ehen the Grand Canyon is around the corner?! After all we liked it there and would recomend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Excellent Location but needs updating
Kind of costly but adequate lodging.
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night on our trip to the Grand Canyon. The hotel is about 7 miles from the south rim, located by several restaurants and shops. The room was clean with several strange features. First, the bed pillows were about 1/2 the size of normal; overstuffed and pretty uncomfortable. I ended folding up a bath towel and using that for a pillow. When we first entered the room, 2 of the lightbulbs were dead which were replaced within the hour. The air conditioner was not cool; luckily it was a cool night so bearable. There were 2 sinks; one was a strange height; very low. The other was normal. The tub was extra large. The room was quiet and the bed was fairly comfortable. The buffet breakfast was adequate. the hifi was free, but incredibly slow. Overall, a decent place, but overpriced.

reviews.title: Our room smelled disgusting.
reviews.text: When we walked into our room we were hit with a repulsive smell. The carpet next to the bathroom was wet and the window to the room wouldn't open. I called the front desk to ask if we could be moved to another room and I was told no. They sent someone to open the window. We had to leave the window open all night despite low temps in the 30s because the smell interfered with our ability to sleep. Overall, I was very disappointed with the Best Western Grand Canyon Squire Inn. The wireless was so weak that it was pretty much useless and the breakfast room was so crowded we needed to sit with strangers. We paid a lot of money and got very little value for our stay.

reviews.title: Good value, courteous staff, excellent facilities
reviews.text: Stayed here after I could not get a reservation within Grand Canyon NP and very glad I did. Keeps you out of the zoo that is GC Village. Very happy with this motel & will likely stay here again. Rooms verged on the luxurious. Amenities included free wifi & a very nice breakfast buffet included in the room rate (also a small fridge & microwave). Staff was courteous & genuinely friendly. Several restaurant options on-site. 10-15 minutes to the GCNP Visitor Center.

reviews.title: Good location, clean, kids liked the breakfast
reviews.text: The hotel was clean and comfortable but pricey (location near the South Rim).The breakfast buffet was large but the dining room was a little bleak. However, we had a very nice dinner in the restaurant and the female bartender/waitress was awesome.

reviews.title: Good value, comfortable, well located, great breakfast
reviews.text: Tusayan (location of the hotel) has few amenities and is basically a strip of hotels & small stores. Our stay in Springdale, UT (Zion National Park) was much more interesting. There's a lot of potential here so hope the local community takes advantage.

This hotel was okay. My huband and I traveled with our two kids to the Grand Canyon. Hotel is about a mile from the entrance to the South Rim. Costs you $25.00 to enter the Grand Canyon Park. Not much at all to do in this town, but see the canyon, see the IMAX movie about the canyon (which was pretty good) and eat. This hotel has a sports bar, an arcade with pool tables, and a bowling alley which was good as nothing else was going on anywhere in town. Also we were snowed in, getting about 15 inches of snow in APRIL?????? The rooms smell of smoke a little from days long ago, but basically good. Food in this town and in the restaurants seemed pricey. But you are in the middle of nowhere. Bar and restaurant staff were kind of slow and forgetfull. But overall I would stay again. Had a flub at check in. Booked two nights and they only had us down for one. Thank goodness they were not sold out or we would have been s.o.l.
reviews.title: Best hotel for Tusayan....

reviews.text: Pretty standard accommodation which lacked charm despite the cowboy stuff in the lobby.
reviews.title: Well located near to Grand Canyon park entrance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms had all the required basics and reception staff were fine and helpful enough. The location was great as it was a few minutes to drive to the park entrance. The restaurant was good enough and reasonably priced by US standards. The breakfast included in the price was very good. An all you can eat buffet which was billed as continental but included scrambled eggs and set you up for the day
reviews.title: South Rim

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove up to the Grand Canyon from Scottsdale on 3/6/11, which was about a 3-1/2hr trip. Left early Sunday morning and went directly to the hotel, which allowed us to check in 3 hours early. We bought our ticket to the Park at the hotel, though you don't save any money by doing this, just might help you go through the line quicker. We stopped at the visitor center and asked which trail to hike on that day. They recommended the South Kaibab trail, due to the snow and ice on some of the other ones. There was still about 10 minutes worth of snow and ice, but we quickly got out of it. We walked down an hour and then it took us an hour to get back up. Rule of thumb says it should've taken two hours back up, but we're in ok shape. We also walked the Rim trail which is easy and provides some great views.
reviews.title: Not bad...

reviews.text: We also went to the IMAX theatre in town that evening, which is worth the visit. The Best Western was a great value for $90 a night. We also ate in the restuarant, which was excellent. The drive back to Scottsdale the next day was a bit like our Wisconsin weather, as we hit a snowstorm and winds in the Flagstaff area. Within the 3-1/2 hour trip, we went from 28F to 78F. So nice to be back in the desert again to enjoy the sunshine!
reviews.title: Better than expected; especially enjoyed the box lunch we ordered.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went with my husband and we stayed two nights in this hotel. It is about 7 miles away from the Grand Canyon rim. The room we had was in the main building and was HUGE! We even had a couch, microwace and fridge. The bathroom had a full-size tub that was inviting us to take a bath. I loved the breakfast buffet that is included in the nightly rate. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to explore the Grand Canyon.
reviews.title: Can't beat the location

reviews.text: Everyone, this really is the best place to stay when visiting the Grand Canyon. Take a look at the century-old accomodations IN the park & you'll run to this place! Loved the architecture....the sculptures, the displays, the canyon "wall". The breakfast is WONDERFUL (except for the yogurt container that you SPOON into your plate. Pretty gross!) Nice staff, gorgeous piano--have the kids bring their piano books, & great mini-bowling alley!
reviews.title: Loved the Location, Loved the atmosphere, but soap dispensers have to GO!

reviews.text: ******IMPORTANT TIP--You MUST bring your own soap, shampoo, & conditioner. There are NO mini, travel sizes here. There are only large, ANCIENT, dispensers that are refilled! No plastic bag inserts to prevent mold from building up, either. EXTREMELY GROSS!!!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Found it VERY strange that I didn't read about this before leaving for our trip--April 20-27.
reviews.title: Not good

reviews.text: Anyway, I survived by buying those items at the gas station! LOL!!!!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a large hotel with many amenities. The rooms are located in several separate buildings with parking surrounding each, yet with convenient access to the lobby. Lobby and guest rooms have pleasant, tasteful decor. The breakfast buffet (included) was average.
reviews.title: very close to Grand Canyon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located very close to the south entrance of Grand Canyon, this is a good choice if you can't find a room in the park. While attractive, it does not have a lodge feel to it. It feels more like a large, impersonal hotel, which it is.
reviews.title: Excellent property close to southern park entrance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly. Our room was not very well cleaned (food crumbs on carpet and floor) but we didn't mention it to the staff since it was past 10 pm when we noticed it and we left early the next am. Check your room when you get there.
reviews.title: Good overnight accommodation close to the South Rim entrance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: AAAA – The amenities include: Bowling alley, Restaurant, Very clean rooms, Coffee in room, Close to southern park entrance (approx. 3 miles), and breakfast buffet. The breakfast buffet was the largest cost included hotel buffet I've ever seen. Included are few pictures.
reviews.title: Convenient but overpriced

reviews.text: Canyon TIPS: When the crowds are huge at Mather's point (where the park rangers send you), park at lots #1 or #2, because #3 and #4 are a long walk to the canyon rim. If Mather's point is crowded, you may want to go to the east entrance road because it is empty compared to Mather's Point and has great looks into the canyon. Try the El Tovar restaurant parking area. If this is not crowded park there since it's about 50 yards to the canyon wall. We drove around it a few times waiting for someone to leave.
reviews.title: Nice location, nice bowling alley...
Not for the Mobility Challenged!
reviews.text: I booked the room requesting wheelchair access. The room was on the second floor of a hotel with no elevator. The second room was also unaccessible. The third room was perfect. First floor unit with parking right outside the door. Too bad the space was not labeled handicapped-someone else used it. The continental breakfast was upstairs, up the ramp and down the hall. Concierge was WONDERFUL. On site restaurant was great. Very nice if you're not traveling with anyone mobility challenged!

Stayed at the hotel in late September 2005 and was pleasantly surprised by the size and cleanlines of the room. We had a non-smoking, king room and for once, it was a true non-smoking room. The one big complaint was the lack of hot water. On two separate occassions there was no hot water. The first was dealt with promptly, but the second, which occurred at 6am, is unexcusable. The front desk did nothing, not even apologize when we complained.
reviews.title: Adequate rooms, but no hot water
Needs refurbished
reviews.text: Other than that the hotel was ok. The breakfast left something to be desired (same thing every day) and the prices for bowling and beer were way too high.
I'd check out the new Grand Hotel across the street next time.
reviews.title: You call this a non-smoking room?
Not Recommended!!
reviews.text: Stayed here one night. The bedrooms need refurbished and the bathroom, although spacious has a very noisey toilet which recyles water all night resulting in a sleepless night for me.

This hotel is in need of some refurbishment. The shower was awful and a very dirty bathmat was provided. There was some aircraft noise. The reception insisted that the check in was not a minute before 4pm. We had to sit in the car for half an hour and wait to check in.
reviews.title: Some problems

reviews.text: We stopped for 2 nights here while exploring the grand canyon. When I saw the lodges in the park itself I ws glad I was stopping here. Rooms are a good size, staff were friendly and helpfull. Only a short distance from the south rim entrance and you could walk to the grand canyon airport were we caught our helicopter. They had had a lightening storm only a few days before our stay which ment our TV was on the blink but they gave us a discount for each night we were there. Not at all bad. Would stop here again.
reviews.title: Not Bad at all!!
Perfect Place to Stay at the grand Canyon
reviews.text: The Best Western Squire Inn has it all. The rooms are large and spacious and the restaurants are excellent. Both the buffet and full service restaurant were very good. It seemed to be the best place to stay outside of the Grand Canyon.

We stayed at the Grand Canyon for 2 nights and thourally enjoyed staying at this Hotel. It was bigger than I thought and had a nice Sports Bar with a cool Jukebox and Pool Table. It is right in the village of Tusayan and has easy walking access to the Restaurants and IMAX Cinema. The airport is very close by as we did the Helicopter Flight which is not to be missed!! The rooms were spacious and clean. On a surprising note, we booked 2 rooms for 4 people and they were next to eachother. Opened a door inside and that linked the 2 rooms together. Small point but it kept the 4 of us in the same place when we wanted a few beers and the TV. But saying that, only happened when the weather was bad... how could we stay in when just around the corner was one of the most magnificent views on earth! Would recommend staying here.
reviews.title: A Great Stay
A disappointment!
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights in June 05. They are doing major landscaping works which make the place look a mess and the pool was closed for refurbishment - we had booked a month ahead and had not been informed of this. The room was clean, but the block itself showed signs of wear and tear and the corridor carpet was worn and un-vacuumed during our whole stay. The main reception looks impressive, but this hides the lack of staff - we left one bar because of the number of people waiting, and the restaurant was equally understaffed and the buffet was cold.

reviews.title: A nice surprise
reviews.text: We arrived late evening to find a welcome surprise - a lovely and clean Premiere Best Western - the staff was more than helpful and welcoming. The location was perfect - a short drive to the Grand Canyon, The atmosphere and decor of the hotel reflected its beautiful surroundings. The hotel offered a breakfast package - a very crowded and busy time - but it was interesting to be seated with many European tourists. I would definitely return.
I actually quite liked the hotel as I thought the positives outweighed the negatives.
reviews.title: Great location, good food from Coronado room, the rest- ok

reviews.text: Positives
reviews.title: Reasonable hotel near one of the most beautiful sights you'll ever see

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location location location
reviews.title: Good hotel, close Grand Canyon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 10 mins drive to the Grand Canyon national park.
reviews.title: Perfect choice for visting the Grand Canyon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the accomodations were generally pretty nice, we were disappointed that the spa, hot tub and exercise facilities were not available, since they are being renovated. This information was neither provided on the website, nor mentioned when I called to make our reservations. When I complained (as we were checking out), I was told they would ensure the website was not misleading; not only did they not offer any funding back, they stated that their prices already reflected the lack of these amenities. However, there is still no indication on their website that these amenities are not available to the prospective guest and the prices listed were commensurate with what we paid. I was disappointed that these facilities were not available (after hiking all day, we could really have used that hot tub!) (and the free high-speed internet often didn't work, or was very slow)
reviews.title: Misleading/Amenities Missing

reviews.text: The breakfasts were plentiful, and had a lot of variety, should suit most tastes. There was also a refrigerator in the room. The service was inconsistent--I'm a tea drinker, and most times the only tea provided was herbal. Sometimes, only decaf coffee was provided. Either the staff didn't have standard guidance, or the guidance wasn't very specific.
reviews.title: Convenient?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being BW fans we stayed here during a GC visit. The stay was quite nice but I can see many negative experiences here. Probably when their renovations are done it will get noticeably better. The parking was terrible, had a bit of a hike to the room, as everyone was packed into a parking area in the back. It seemed that roadways were one way and congested. We were lucky to have a more modern room and everything was updated and had all the conveniences of a BW. Internet didn't seem to cooperate too well, and doors didn't close. They think this place is upscale, but it isn't. The resident restaurant is costly, but might be the only fine dining in the area.The other restaurant was closed, probably seasonal as well. With it being the off season, we paid a bit too much for the room, therefore no value.. I guess to have higher rates is the draw of the GC. The only real positive here is the hot breakfast was near the best we've ever had. If the GC didn't draw people, this hotel might be in trouble, therefore just average in my opinion, and will probably search elsewhere next time.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: We stayed at the Best Western Grand Canyon Squire Inn because of its location to the Grand Canyon and because they have a discount for AARP members. It was better than expected and from the many activities on site, I think families would like it there too. The rooms are more than adequate and very clean. From what I've read, the rooms are larger than the Inns inside the Grand Canyon. There is a very good restaurant and lounge. The breakfast is cafeteria style, included in the room price, and offers most anything you would want for breakfast. However, don't expect fresh-to-cook omelets. One complaint; this hotel doesn't have an elevator to the 2nd floor. My husband has a bad back and hauling luggage was a problem but we managed. If you need an elevator, ask for a room on the 1st floor. The staff is very polite and helpful. If we return to the Grand Canyon, we would definitely stay here.
reviews.title: Decent bargain!

reviews.text: The place is close to Grand canyon - 5 to 7 minutes drive.
reviews.title: No Warning About Loud Renovation In Guest Room Hallway

aka: Best Western Premier Grand Canyon Squire Hotel
description: At the BEST WESTERN PREMIER Grand Canyon Squire Inn, we’re proud to be the finest property at The Grand Canyon in Tusayan, Arizona. Moments away from the South Rim entrance to Grand Canyon National Park, our property offers all the amenities you expect and deserve from a fine hotel. We are pleased to provide you with the ultimate Grand Canyon hotel experience. Allow us to anticipate your every need here at the South Rim, the heart of Grand Canyon's National Park. By day, let your senses come alive in the unique ecosystem of the Grand Canyon and the high desert of the Coconino Plateau. By night, come home to the genteel oasis of the Best Western Grand Canyon Squire Inn. Whether your trip to the canyon is a once-in-a-lifetime adventure or a much needed escape to nature, make us your first and only choice for lodging. Our warm, relaxed ambiance is the perfect end to a day in the magnificent American Southwest. With a variety of dining and entertainment choices on our expansive grounds, we’re sure to please guests of all ages. Our array of guest services, magnificent art collection, fireside lounge and Family Fun Center will make us your favorite place to unwind. Our beautifully appointed rooms were designed with your complete comfort in mind. At our Grand Canyon hotel, you can experience an exquisite sunset, relax under the stars and wake up to a spectacular sunrise when lodging with us. The Best Western Grand Canyon Squire Inn offers an unexpected grandeur, uniquely suited to a Grand Canyon South Rim hotel. We promise you a remarkable, memorable experience at the Grand Canyon, one of the premier world heritage sites.
